keyword: how many calories in a boston cream donut
title: How Many Calories in a Boston Cream Donut?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a boston cream donut, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Boston Cream Donut?
assumptions: Standard bakery size (~70 g), yeast dough filled with vanilla custard, topped with chocolate glaze; no nuts or extra fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, size, and preparation; homemade or store-bought versions differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A Boston cream donut typically contains about 350 calories.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Boston cream donut?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 calories for a standard one.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a Boston cream donut?
faqs.a: About 45 g total carbs, including 25 g sugars and 1 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is a Boston cream donut high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 18 g fat, with 8 g saturated fat from the glaze and frying.

faqs.q: How much protein in a Boston cream donut?
faqs.a: Roughly 5 g protein, mostly from the dough and custard.

faqs.q: Does brand affect calories in Boston cream donuts?
faqs.a: Yes, chains like Dunkin' may vary from 300-400 kcal based on size and recipe.
